name: Northgate
shortDesc: Home of the first covered mall in the United States

name: University District
shortDesc: Famous for eclectic mix of urban shopping areas; historic homes and architecture; and great cafes, pubs, restaurants, and theaters

name: Ballard
shortDesc: Walkable, historic, and full of fun things to do, Ballard is a hot spot for young and old

name: Fremont
shortDesc: Delicious food, quirky shops, public art, and stellar views of Seattle’s skyline

name: Wallingford
shortDesc: World-renowned Gas Works Park, and views of both the Olympic and Cascade mountains

name: Queen Anne
shortDesc: These hills are abuzz with adventures for the whole family plus spectacular scenery and indie shops

name: Eastlake
shortDesc: A low-key, funky area of brightly colored homes and small businesses right by the water

name: Montlake
shortDesc: Montlake is a quiet, affluent neighborhood full of parks and well-maintained single-family homes

name: South Lake Union
shortDesc: The home base for Seattle’s thriving tech scene also holds a mélange of attractive sights, sips, and flavors

name: Downtown
shortDesc: The central business district of Seattle, Washington

name: Capitol Hill
shortDesc: Vibrating with life, Capitol Hill brims with eclectic venues and a community feel

name: Belltown
shortDesc: Walkable and cool, Belltown has an artsy, laid-back vibe

name: Leschi
shortDesc: A mellow neighborhood on coveted real estate overlooking Lake Washington

name: Pioneer Square
shortDesc: The birthplace of Seattle, historic place known for its Renaissance Revival architecture, First Thursday art walks, night life, delicious lunch spots, and quirky boutiques

name: Chinatown/International District
shortDesc: The cultural hub for Seattle’s Asian American communities

name: West Seattle
shortDesc: Hop on the water taxi from downtown to this lovely, low-key corner of the city
